data.title: Diaz Represents MTEN as ITA Rookie of the Year
data.meta_description: TEMPE, Ariz. – LUIS DIAZ was honored as the 2018 ITA Rookie of the Year Wednesday evening when the Intercollegiate Tennis Association released its 2018 Division
data.text:
Luis Diaz is fourth Hilltopper to win ITA Rookie of the Year Award

TEMPE, Ariz. – LUIS DIAZ was honored as the 2018 ITA Rookie of the Year Wednesday evening when the Intercollegiate Tennis Association released its 2018 Division II regional award winners. Diaz will be recognized on May 8 at the opening of the 2018 Division II NCAA Tennis Championships in Surprise, Ariz.

Diaz is the fourth Hilltopper to achieve this feat, following in the footsteps of Boris Barrios (2007), Ned Boone (2010), and RICARDO PINEDA (2017).

The true freshman moved to No. 1 in the school's single-season record book with 24 singles wins, passing Kendall Smashey (2003) and Mario Quintero (2004) who both registered 23 wins. In singles this year, Diaz posted a 17-4 mark this spring and an impressive 5-1 record vs. nationally-ranked opponents. He is also tied for first in the single-season record book with 24 doubles wins this year joining CHARLIE SHIN (2016), Kenton Venhizen (2004), and Quintero (2004).

The Hilltoppers (21-9) are set to face No. 1 Barry in the first round of the NCAA Division II National Tournament May 9 at 11 a.m. Listed below is the remainder of the 2018 Division II regional award winners are listed below.

Follow St. Edward's men's tennis all season long on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram using the handle @SEUMTennis.
